Grouped_Utterances: I guess I’m just curious about how to manage my feelings of anxiety when I’m working on something big.

Yeah, actually, I landed a couple of new gigs. It's been exciting! It's really fulfilling. I feel like I'm finally getting recognized for my skills. I love the creativity involved and meeting new people. Each project has its own vibe. A bit, yeah. I still feel shy, but I push through it. I think the excitement of the work helps. It pushes me to think outside the box and try new techniques. I want to keep evolving. A bit nervous, but mostly excited. I think it’ll help me process my feelings about the transition. That’s a relevant concern. Have you experienced anxiety in the past when working on significant projects? Yes, especially when deadlines approach. I tend to overthink things.
It’s been okay. I called my parents last week, and it was nice to catch up.
I felt a bit guilty for not visiting them more often, but I also reminded myself that I’m busy with work.

I think so, especially when meeting new friends. It helps me open up more. Yes! I went to a gallery opening last weekend, and it was really inspiring. Just seeing the different styles and meeting artists who share the same passion was energizing.
